solution_line_template: Since there are {minutes_per_hour} minutes in 1 hour, then {sarah_time_hours} hours is equal to {sarah_time_hours} x {minutes_per_hour} = <<{sarah_time_hours}*{minutes_per_hour}={sarah_time_minutes}>>{sarah_time_minutes} minutes.
Thus, Samuel is {sarah_time_minutes} - {samuel_time_minutes} = <<{sarah_time_minutes}-{samuel_time_minutes}={time_difference_minutes}>>{time_difference_minutes} minutes faster than Sarah.
